definition: to end abstinence/to resume (drinking) after a break/to break (a taboo)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: If you don't drink, this is not a reason to start.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是不喝酒的，那就没有理由开戒喝酒。

definition: to violate a religious precept/to smoke or drink after giving up
to go against the rules (of a religious order)/to break a ban (e.g. medical)
to give up drinking/to abstain from drinking
to abstain from eating meat/to be a vegetarian
(Buddhism) to initiate sb for monkhood or nunhood
to take oaths as a monk (Buddhism)/to take orders
to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
never to touch a drop of alcohol
